meanings.definition: The action of attributing something to someone.
meanings.sent1: The imputation of the missing cookies was directed at the dog.
meanings.sent2: In court, the imputation of guilt must be proven beyond a reasonable doubt.
meanings.sent3: The imputation of superhero powers to the cat made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her imputation of wisdom to the old tree was a reminder of its enduring strength.
meanings.sent5: The imputation of magic to the old book made it seem even more mysterious.

meanings.definition: The act of charging or attributing something to a person or group.
meanings.sent1: The financial imputation of the expenses was causing tension in the team.
meanings.sent2: The imputation of blame on the youngest sibling was unfair.
meanings.sent3: The imputation of superhero abilities to the hamster was a hilarious joke.
meanings.sent4: His imputation of laziness to the slow-moving turtle was a clever analogy.
meanings.sent5: The imputation of magical powers to the wizard was awe-inspiring.
